meanings.definition: To fold or crease in advance.
meanings.sent1: She carefully precreased the paper before starting the origami project.
meanings.sent2: He always precreased his clothes before packing them in the suitcase.
meanings.sent3: The teacher precreased the test papers to make it easier for the students to fold them.
meanings.sent4: The tailor's skilled hands precreased the fabric with precision.
meanings.sent5: Precreasing the edges of the envelope helps it maintain its shape during mailing.

meanings.definition: Having been folded or creased before use.
meanings.sent1: She wore a precreased shirt to the job interview.
meanings.sent2: The precreased map was easy to unfold and read.
meanings.sent3: The precreased napkin looked fancy on the dinner table.
meanings.sent4: The precreased dollar bills were neatly stacked in the cash register.
meanings.sent5: The precreased document had a professional look to it.
